snippet: Allowing foreign retailers in India divides Indians as much by age as by livelihood.
abstract: Allowing foreign retailers in India divides Indians as much by age as by livelihood.
lead_paragraph: “A long-festering controversy about whether India should allow foreign retailers like Wal-Mart into the country has often been cast as a battle between millions of small shopkeepers and large corporate interests,” Vikas Bajaj wrote in The New York Times. But in much of the country the issue often divides Indians as much by age as by their livelihoods, he wrote.

headline.main: Younger Indians Eager to Embrace Foreign Big-Box Stores and Malls
